document.docAuthor: Castro, Tatiane Marie Martins Gomes De & Heyer, Jacob Den
document.docTitle: Pulaeus quadrisolenidius Castro & Heyer, 2009, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the genus Pulaeus Den Heyer, with descriptions of a new genus and four new Brazilian species (Acari: Prostigmata: Cunaxidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the genus Pulaeus Den Heyer, with descriptions of a new genus and four new Brazilian species (Acari: Prostigmata: Cunaxidae)

mods:name.mods:namePart: Castro, Tatiane Marie Martins Gomes De

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. This species resembles
P. franciscae
, but differs from the latter by the presence of 4 solenidia on genua I instead of 3 .

Female (
Figs. 3–4
)
(n= 13 ). Idiosoma: length 252 ( 237–287 ) and width 176 ( 150–212 ).

Dorsum (
Fig. 3
A). Dorsal shield slightly punctated with sensillae ( vi and sce ) setose; dimensions:
vi 90
( 80–107 ), ve 23 ( 20–27 ), sci 16 ( 12–22 ), sce 78 ( 67–87 ),
c 1
12 ( 10–15 ),
c 2
12 ( 10–12 ),
d 1
13 ( 10–17 ) and
e 1
15
( 12–17 ). Posteriad to the dorsal idiosomal shield one pair of tiny platelets occur that carring setae
f 1
19 ( 15–22 ) and
f 2
11 ( 10–12 ) each. Setae
h 1
22 ( 17–25 ) and
h 2
13 occur on the integument.

Ven t er (
Fig. 3
B). The venter resembles that of
P. myrtaceus
sp. nov.
, but with 7 or 8 hysterogastral setae.

Gnathosoma
(
Fig. 3
C–D). Hypostome 117 ( 100–127 ) long, bearing 4 pairs of hg setae [
hg 1
11 ( 10–15 ),
hg 2
13 ( 10–17 ),
hg 3
35 ( 30–37 ) and
hg 4
10 ( 7–12 )] and 2 pairs of adoral setae. Three- jointed palp, 74 ( 62–87 ) long. Trochanter without setae; femorogenu, 6 sts; tibiotarsus, 4 sts, 1 asl terminal, 1 bladder-like apophysis and 1 ventral pointed process. Chelicera 116 ( 105–120 ) long with cheliceral seta 7 .

Legs (
Fig. 4
A–D). Length of legs: I 165 ( 145–197 ), II 140 ( 120–170 ), III 158 ( 142–195 ), IV 171 ( 155–202 ); length of tarsi:
I 62
( 55–72 ),
II 47
( 40–60 ),
III 44
( 37–50 ),
IV 45
( 37–52 ). The leg chaetotaxy is as follows: coxae I—IV, 1 peg, 3 sts— 3 sts— 3 sts— 2 sts; trochanters I—IV, 1 sts— 1 sts— 2 sts— 1 sts; basifemora I—IV, 4 sts— 6 sts— 3 sts— 2 sts; telofemora I—IV, 5 sts— 5 sts— 1 ms, 3 sts— 1 ms, 2 sts; genua I—IV, 3 asl, { 1 asl, 1 sts}, 4 sts— 2 asl, 5 sts— 1 asl, 5 sts— 1 asl, 5 sts; tibiae I—IV, 1 asl, 1 bsl, 5 sts— 1 bsl, 5 sts— 1 bsl, 5 sts— 1 T, 4 sts; tarsi I—IV, 1 asl, 3 bsl, 1 dep + peo, 1 dtsl, 2 tsl, 22 sts— 1 bsl, 1 dtsl, 1 tsl, 19 sts— 1 tsl, 16 sts— 17 sts.

Male (
Fig. 4
).
(n= 3 ). Dimensions. Idiosoma: length 191 ( 175–212 ) and width 143 ( 135–165 ).

Dorsum (
Fig. 4
E). The dorsum is similar to that of the female; dimensions:
vi 85
( 77–90 ), ve 25 ( 22–27 ), sci 16 ( 15–17 ), sce 75 ( 72–80 ),
c 1
12 ,
c 2
12 ( 10–12 ),
d 1
12 and
e 1
12
( 12–15 ). Posteriad to the dorsal idiosomal shield one pair of tiny platelets occur carring setae
f 1
15 and
f 2
8 ( 7–10 ) each. Setae
h 1
17 and
h 2
13 occur on the integument.

Ven ter (
Fig. 4
F). Propodosomal coxal plates fused medially. One pair of paracoxal setae occurs on the coxal region IV. The integument bears 1 pair of propodogastral setae and 3 pairs of hysterogastral setae. Paragenital setae are not present. The genital valves are smaller than those of the females, each bearing 4 gsetae .

Gnathosoma .
The gnathosoma is similar to that of the female. Hypostome 105 ( 100–112 ) long with 4 pairs of hg -setae [
hg 1
13 ( 12–15 ),
hg 2
15 ( 15–17 ),
hg 3
38 ( 35–42 ) and
hg 4
10 ] and 2 pairs of adoral setae. Threejointed palp, 74 ( 70–77 ) long. Chelicera 106 ( 100–110 ) long with cheliceral setae 10 .

Legs. Length of legs: I 153 ( 145–160 ), II 128 ( 125–137 ), III 142 ( 135–150 ), IV 152 ( 145–157 ); length of tarsi:
I 57
( 55–60 ),
II 45
( 42–47 ),
III 39
( 37–42 ),
IV 41
( 40–45 ). The leg chaetotaxy differs from that of female as follows: genua I—IV, 2 asl, 1 bsl, { 1 asl, 1 sts}, 4 sts— 1 asl, 1 bsl, 5 sts— 1 asl, 5 sts— 1 asl, 5 sts.

Type material.
Holotype female, from leaf litter of
Euterpe edulis Mart.
( Arecaceae ),
11 .VII. 2000
, Pariquera-Açu, A.R. Oliveira.

Paratypes . Cananéia :
1 female
, from leaf litter
A. aculeatissimum
,
18 .I. 2000
, A.R. Oliveira;
1 male
, from leaf litter of
E. edulis
,
12 .VII. 2000
, A.R. Oliveira;
1 female
, from leaf litter of
Syagrus romanzoffiana (Cham.)
( Euphorbiaceae ),
18 .I.00
, A.R. Oliveira.

Pariquera-Açu :
1 female
, from leaf litter of of
S. romanzoffiana
,
11 .VII. 2000
, A.R. Oliveira;
1 male
, from roots of
E. edulis
,
18 .IV. 2000
, A.R. Oliveira;
1 male
, from roots of
E . edulis
,
11 .VII. 2001
, A.R. Oliveira.

Pirassununga :
3 females
, from soil,
27 .VII. 2000
, A.R. Oliveira.

São Carlos :
2 females
, from soil,
25 .VII. 2000
, A.R. Oliveira.

São Pedro :
4 females
, from leaf litter of
Syagrus oleraceae (Mart.) Becc.
( Arecaceae ),
10 .VIII. 2000
, A.R. Oliveira.
Etymology. The species designation refers to the presence of four solenidia on genu I.
